Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: Draw a simple representation of a land habitat (e.g., a basic outline of a tree or a patch of grass) without much detail.
Include a basic shape to represent something in a water habitat (e.g., a wavy line for water, possibly a simple fish shape).
Show a limited or single type of living thing in each habitat without variety (e.g., repeated use of the same animal or plant).
CANNOT: Illustrate two distinct habitats effectively, especially differentiating between land and water environments (student may draw both habitats too similarly).
Include various living things like trees, specific animals, and plants correctly or in their appropriate habitat (student might place animals in the wrong habitat).
Organize the drawing to showcase a range of living things in each habitat (student might focus too much on one kind of living thing).
Highlight differences between the types of living things found in each habitat (student may not understand what differentiates animals in separate habitats).
Identify patterns or similarities among living things in different habitats (student might not grasp the concept of patterns or similarities).
